intro: Chaenostoma polelense, commonly known as the Polelense water starwort, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant typically grows in shallow freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are submerged, ribbon-like, and often form dense mats on the water surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually borne on short stalks above the water.
